title: Platform Engineer
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M is on a journey to meet and exceed our customers' expectations today and tomorrow. Through collaboration, innovation, and technology, we challenge ourselves and the industry. To cater to the individual needs and desires of our millions of customers, our tech organization delivers solutions for the entire value chain for all our brands. We are accelerating digitalization, and to stay relevant, we need to ensure we have strong leaders in place to bring our best capabilities, innovation ideas, and talented technologists to support the transformation of H&M.
   

  

 Would you like to work in an internationally agile-driven environment on solutions used in various parts of the world? Do you consider yourself a proactive, self-driven colleague who can take full ownership of the initiative working both independently and as part of a group?
   

  

**Job Description**
 At H&M, our AI, Analytics, and Data department is at the cutting edge of data-driven decision-making. We leverage advanced analytics, AI, and machine learning to tackle complex challenges and drive business growth. Our team is dynamic, innovative, and dedicated to pushing the boundaries of what’s possible with data. We are seeking a skilled Backend Developer to join our talented team and contribute to our mission of enabling the full enterprise to harness the power of data.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Design, build, and maintain data pipelines on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) using services such as BigQuery, Dataplex, Dataflow/Dataproc, Pub/Sub, Cloud Functions, Cloud Run, Cloud Scheduler and Cloud Workflows.
* Develop and implement data models using dbt (data build tool) to support analytical reporting and data science needs.
* Collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into data models.
* Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure high quality of data in our data warehouse.
* Optimize data pipelines and data models for performance and cost efficiency.
* Document and communicate data models to the wider team and train them on how to use it effectively.
* Good knowledge of Terraform
* Experience in building CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
* Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
* Strong experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and its data services such as BigQuery, Cloud Run, and Pub/Sub.
* Experience in data modelling and transformation using dbt.
* Knowledge of SQL and good experience with Python.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain complex topics in simple terms.


 Why Join Us?
   

  

* Innovative Environment: Work on cutting-edge technologies and innovative projects.
* Professional Growth: Opportunities for continuous learning and professional development.
* Collaborative Culture: Be part of a supportive team that values collaboration and excellence.
* Competitive Benefits: We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and flexible working arrangements.


 If you are passionate about backend development and eager to work on exciting projects that make a real impact, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join our team and help us shape the future of data-driven innovation!
   

  

**Additional Information**
 This is a fulltime position with placement in Stockholm. If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with CV in English.
   

  

**Please do not send applications to individual email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page. We look forward to receiving your application!**
*H&M is committed to creating a diverse & inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age.*

title: .Net Developer
description:
**Expleo** 
 is seeking a highly skilled and experienced
 **.Net Developer** 
 to join our team in
 **Stockholm, Sweden.**
 Our
 **ideal** 
 candidate possess the ability to write functional code and have a keen eye for identifying and resolving defects. Your primary objective will be to collaborate with our internal teams to design, develop, and maintain high-quality software solutions.
   

  

 If you have a genuine passion for the .NET framework and possess a strong understanding of software design and architecture , and you are excited about shaping the future of technology, we encourage you to apply and be part of the Expleo team in Sweden.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Participate in requirements analysis
* Collaborate with internal teams to produce software design and architecture
* Write clean, scalable code using .NET programming languages
* Test and deploy applications and systems
* Revise, update, refactor and debug code
* Improve existing software
* Develop documentation throughout the software development life cycle (SDLC)
* Serve as an expert on applications and provide technical support


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience as a .NET Developer
* Familiarity with the ASP.NET framework, SQL Server and design/architectural patterns (e.g. Model-View-Controller (MVC))
* Knowledge of at least one of the .NET languages (e.g. C#, Visual Basic .NET) and HTML5/CSS3
* Familiarity with architecture styles/APIs (REST, RPC)
* Understanding of Agile methodologies
* Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills
* Attention to detail
* BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field
* Experience with salesforce application will be beneficial


**Benefits**
**Who are we?**
 Expleo is a rapidly growing consulting company dedicated to delivering innovative solutions in the fields of AI engineering, digitalization, hyper-automation, cybersecurity, and data science. With a strong commitment to integrity, diversity, sustainability, and societal security, Expleo is at the forefront of creating a better future. Join our dynamic team and be part of our journey to shape the future of technology and business.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
* Join a rapidly growing consulting company at the forefront of technological innovation.
* Work in a dynamic and diverse environment that values integrity and sustainability.
* Collaborate with experts in AI engineering, digitalization, hyper-automation, cybersecurity, and data science.
* Opportunities for career growth and development.
* Be part of a team dedicated to creating a more secure and sustainable society.


 "We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age ”.

title: Fullstack Developer - Application Services
description:
Clean-energy tech leads to a positive global transformation. Heating homes contribute to 15% of Europe's CO2 emissions. Switching to sustainable solutions offers households a way to achieve net-zero emissions.
   

  

 Aira's mission is to advance the next generation of home energy solutions, creating intelligent, sustainable homes for a meaningful impact. Starting with innovative heat pumps, it will evolve into a comprehensive, intelligent clean energy-tech system and include dynamic electrical tariffs, cutting-edge home solar systems, and advanced battery storage solutions.
   

  

 Founded in 2022 with already 600 employees and growing, Aira aims to drive the clean energy revolution. We are headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, and our factory in Poland brings these innovations to life, with operating markets in the UK, Italy, and Germany.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Join our expanding Engagement team as a full-stack developer focused on creating web and digital applications for our internal users. These applications enable exceptional customer support and maintenance for our products.
   

  

 You'll work within the IoT Management workstream, where we develop tools for seamless device management, monitoring, and updates. This helps us address product-related issues proactively and reactively, enhancing quality and customer satisfaction.
   

  

 The IoT Management workstream is crucial in optimizing the customer journey and supporting informed energy decisions. Your role is key in ensuring our devices, like heat pumps, function as intended. The team is responsible for:
   

  

  

* Managing firmware and software updates
* Enabling device health monitoring
* Handling alarms
* Assisting troubleshooting with telemetric data visualization
* Enabling remote commands for internal users
* Implementing predictive maintenance
* Tracking device lifecycle states


**What You Will Be Doing**
* Leveraging your solid experience in product-driven software development, with proficiency in Java, Angular 2, and Kotlin.
* Actively engaging in ongoing discussions regarding design and device lifecycles.
* Writing clean, scalable code and conducting thorough testing, enhancing, and maintaining your code.
* Overseeing and enhancing our databases and overall infrastructure.
* Demonstrating expertise in system architecture.
* Applying Agile methodologies and collaborating in cross-functional teams.
* Building and integrating APIs.
* Knowledge of AWS, Kotlin, Spring Boot, and experience working with connected devices and IoT would be a plus.


**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy the flexibility of our hybrid work model and discover our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan subway station just a few minutes walk away.


 Aira leads in the next generation of Energy. We are driven by our belief that the power of diversity fuels innovation. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team, united in our mission to create a better future for society and the planet.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Direct Payments)
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***
**Who We Are…**
 When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the
 *storytellers* 
 bringing our characters to life, the
 *creators* 
 bringing them to your living rooms and the
 *dreamers* 
 creating what’s next…
   

  

 From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.
   

  

 The Direct to Consumer Group is a technology company within the Warner Bros. Discovery brand. We are building a global streaming video platform (OTT), and a suite of applications to power max and all of our other network’s brands globally. We are building modern container-based micro-services operated on AWS. Our platform covers everything from search, catalog, video transcoding, personalization, and payments, to global subscriptions, and really much more. We build user experiences ranging from classic lean-back viewing to i teractive learning applications. We build for connected TVs, web, mobile phones, tablets, and consoles for a large footprint of WBD-owned networks around the world.
   

  

**About Us**
 Our Stockholm Engineering team shipped the core services of Warner Bros. Discovery’s growing streaming video platform. We are now a hub for a growing global engineering group of hundreds of software engineers. We are looking for technically deep, analytical software engineers to join our growing Stockholm team. If your interest lies in building highly scalable container-based services, then this may be the team for you.
   

  

 We are now hiring Senior Software Development Engineers to join our Direct Payments team in Stockholm to help shape WBD’s state-of-the-art Payments Platform with tax, fraud, and DTC payment methods such as card payments, PayPal payments, and payment methods on local markets across the globe.
   

  

**About The Role**
* You are able to work autonomously to design and develop functional changes to existing software systems. You require little or no guidance from team members. You still actively seek input where appropriate and engage your team to inform and share what you are doing.
* You can collaborate with other engineers to assist with features another engineer designed or take the lead on feature design yourself. Your software contributions are demonstrated to work in production, and your team trusts your decisions, designs, and code.
* You are able to describe and defend your design and code decisions to other engineers, embrace constructive feedback, and adapt your approach to align with team and company standards and objectives.
* You consistently demonstrated good software ownership practices (e.g.code reviews, code comments, etc) in all of your contributions. Your code reviews are uneventful, you prepare documentation proactively, and you ensure proper monitoring for operational excellence in production.
* You offer enhancements to best practices, document, design, and architecture improvements, and as feedback through code reviews to other engineers without continuous prompting or recurring encouragement. Other engineers appreciate your feedback.
* You can troubleshoot a production issue by reviewing source code, logs, operational metrics, stack trace, etc to pinpoint a specific problem and then resolve it.


***Preferred skills but not limited to..***
  

  

* At least 7 years of industry experience where payment domains are a plus.
* Proficient in Java and a few other languages.
* Persistence and caching solutions such as PostgreSQL, Redis, ElasticSearch, Caffeine.
* Micro-service-based architectures using gRPC and Kafka for interservice communication.
* Asynchronous, non-blocking, functional style of programming and experience implementing with frameworks such as Spring WebFlux, Node.js, vert.x
* Usage and deep understanding of Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS.
* Experience in building, operating, and truly owning services. Implementing alerting, metrics, and logging using Prometheus, CloudWatch, Kibana, PagerDuty.


**How We Get Things Done…**
 This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.
   

  

**Championing Inclusion at WBD**
 Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law.
   

  

 If you’re a qualified candidate and you require adjustments or accommodations to search for a job opening or apply for a position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.

title: JIRA-utvecklare *2
description:
**Uppdragsbeskrivning:**
 I det här avropet söker vi två utvecklare med erfarenhet av Atlassian Jira.
   

  

 Kunden har ett pågående uppdrag med visionen att det ska vara enkelt att ansluta till förvaltningsgemensam infrastruktur. Uppdraget omfattar att skapa tydlig och ändamålsenlig information om anslutningar till digital infrastruktur, skapa en effektivare och skalbar anslutnings- och avtalsprocess, förbättrad kundupplevelse och en ökad kapacitet för att hantera anslutningsärenden hos kunden.
   

  

 En del av uppdraget handlar om anslutningshantering och där är Atlassians Jira en del av lösningsförslaget. För att leverera lösningen kring anslutningshantering så behöver kunden förstärkning inom Jira.
   

  

 Uppdraget kommer bedrivas i nära dialog med kravställare, UX:are, testare och andra utvecklare som designar och utvecklar programvara.
   

  

**Kompetenskrav:**
 Jirautvecklaren ska uppfylla följande:
   

  

* erfarenhet av att konfigurera/vidareutveckla service desk (Atlassian Jira), minst 2 år
* erfarenhet av att konfigurera/vidareutveckla software (Atlassian Jira), minst 2 år
* erfarenhet av att utveckla integrationer mellan service desk och software (Atlassian Jira)
* erfarenhet av att utveckla integrationer mellan ipax och service desk (Atlassian Jira)


 Jirautvecklaren bör uppfylla följande:
   

  

* erfarenhet av Jira assets
* erfarenhet av att utveckla automatiserade tester
* erfarenhet av att sätta upp Atlassian Jira miljö
* erfarenhet av migrering till Atlassian Jira, ska styrkas av minst 1 referensuppdrag


**Omfattning: 100%**
**Stationering: Stockholm eller Sundsvall**
**Avtalstid:**
 Avtalet gäller från och med 2024-10-14 och med 2025-10-13 med möjlighet till en förlängning á 12 månader.
   

  

**Språk: Svenska**
**Vänligen ansök snarast med:**
* Ditt uppdaterade CV
* Timpris (inkl. omkostnader)
* Tillgänglighetsdatum
* En kort motivering varför du är lämplig uppdraget.

title: Senior Key Account Manager
description: Full stack developer

title: Lead Developer till PE Accounting
description:
**Vill du arbeta på ett dynamiskt och innovativt produktbolag? Blir en del av vårt team som Lead Developer!**
 👉🏼 Hos oss blir du en del av ett starkt team av engagerade utvecklare vars dagliga arbete & åsikter är avgörande för bolagets fortsatta tillväxt. Som utvecklare på PE arbetar du i en helt egenutvecklad produkt, som vi utvecklar och produktionssätter och du får stor kreativ frihet och möjligheter att ständigt växa i rollen som utvecklare på PE.
   

  

**Vår Utvecklingsmiljö**
 Vi är ett produktbolag med en modern, agil utvecklingsprocess där teamen själva sätter sina milstolpar och sköter prioriteringen utifrån uppsatta affärsmål. Vi tror starkt på att det är roligare att arbeta om man förstår användarnas behov och ser utmaningar och möjligheter. Därför arbetar varje squad med en del av applikationen, men i hela teknikstacken. Vårt inhouse-utvecklingsteam består idag av utvecklare fördelat på 5 team, där teamen samarbetar nära en dedikerad produktägare.
   

  

 Kodbasen, som till största del är skriven i Java, är välskriven och vi kvalitetssäkrar vår kod genom automatiserade tester. Vi uppgraderar löpande till senaste versionen av våra verktyg och tredjepartskomponenter. Hela miljön är containerbaserad och releaser görs veckovis.
   

  

 Vi har ett helt nytt, fräscht och påkostat kontor i centrala Stockholm (Fleminggatan 14) där vi möts, tar en pingismatch, utbyter idéer och samlas runt en whiteboard eller för ett retrospective. Vi vet att även flexibilitet i vardagen är viktigt, därför finns det även möjligheten att arbeta remote!
   

  

**Rollen Som Lead Developer På PE**
 Vi tror att du trivs i ett modernt produktbolag och i en roll där du får chans att verkligen vara med och påverka produkten och utvecklingen av den. Vi ser även kunskapsdelning och informellt ledar-/mentorskap för teamet som en naturlig del av rollen.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden i rollen 👇🏼**
* Stöttar och coacha utvecklare i teamet, exempelvis genom feedback vid pull request
* Ansvarig för att utveckla helheten för produkten tillsammans med övriga Lead Developers
* Ansvarar för att teamet lyckas i leveransen tillsammans med Engineering Manager
* Delta i hela utvecklingscykeln – från kravspecifikation till implementering
* Samarbeta nära Product Owner, Engineering Manager och teammedlemmar för att säkerställa att produktens vision och tekniska mål uppnås
* Ett tekniskt ansvar för en del av applikationen när det kommer till datamodell, arkitektur, prestanda, säkerhet m.m.
* Bidra med din tekniska expertis och erfarenhet för att kontinuerligt förbättra våra utvecklingsprocesser


**Vem är du?**
 Vi tror att du har flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av Java samt SQL och du är inte rädd för att komma med egna tankar och idéer som vi tillsammans förverkligar! Du talar och skriver svenska obehindrat. Som person är du nyfiken och motiveras av att testa och lära dig nya saker inom ditt område.
   

  

**Mer Om PE Som Bolag**
 Vi grundades 2011 och är ett modernt & värderingsstyrt produktbolag. I över 12 år har vi skapat innovation och hjälpt små & medelstora bolag att automatisera sin ekonomi. Vi har en väldigt stabil affärsmodell som bolag och växer organiskt, med sunda finanser - vilket bland annat har gjort oss till sexfaldiga DI Gaseller. I skrivande stund närmar vi oss 200 kollegor och finns med kontor i centrala Stockholm, Göteborg & Malmö.
   

  

*Vi ser verkligen fram emot att höra ifrån dig!*
 Se mer om oss på: accounting.pe/karriar & instagram.com/peaccounting
   

  

 Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller i slutskedet av våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

**Sökord: Java 19, Spring, Docker, REST, Linux, MySQL, Microservices, IntelliJ, Jenkins, Git, Remix. Fullstack, Backend, Produktbolag.**
 Vi på PE Accounting ändrar sättet världen ser på ekonomi- och lönehantering!
   

  

 Vårt automatiserade system, i kombination med vår tjänsteleverans bildar tillsammans en helhetslösning som ger våra kunder möjligheten att outsourca sin ekonomifunktion, och samtidigt behålla 100% kontroll - i realtid.
   

  

 Vi har en stabil affärsmodell, där över 90% av intäkterna är prenumerationsbaserade. Tillväxten har skett organiskt och med sunda finanser. Vi har fått utmärkelsen DI Gasell sex år i rad och är ett värderingsstyrt bolag med stort fokus på glädje, ansvar, prestigelöshet och nyfikenhet!

title: Senior System Engineer
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
 At King, the Engineering System & Support (ESS) team provides critical capabilities for our developers, including continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD), build infrastructure, and dependent services. Our team manages repository solutions for code, binaries, and libraries, build pipelines, and code quality/review tools. These components are integrated into a cohesive stack that includes configuration management, tool integrations, and infrastructure technologies.
   

  

 We are now seeking an experienced and passionate Senior Systems Engineer to join our team and help us build on this success!
   

  

 We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about the role. Not sure you meet all other qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.
   

  

**Your Role Within Our Kingdom**
 As a Sr. Systems Engineer on the ESS team, you will be involved in large-scale system design and troubleshooting, your focus will be to provide a high quality Developer Experience by implementing and improving ESS services and products. Our main goal as a team is to contribute to speed up the Game Development Lifecycle.
   

  

 Skills To Create Thrills
   

  

**Skills To Create Thrills**
 We are seeking a talented DevOps Engineer with expertise in managing Linux (Debian, Ubuntu) operating systems, which is required, while experience with Windows OS and Mac OSX is desired. In the realm of configuration management and Infrastructure as Code (IaaC), you should have required experience with Puppet (r10K, Hiera, Modules, PuppetDB) and Terraform. Packer and Helm experience is also desirable.
   

  

 You must have required experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP, along with Docker and Kubernetes. For development services, proficiency in Git is required, and familiarity with the GitHub ecosystem, Artifactory, Jenkins, SonarQube, Perforce, Incredibuild, and Veertu Anka Build is desirable.
   

  

 Your scripting skills should include Bash as a requirement, with Python, Groovy (for automation), and PowerShell as desired skills. Experience managing web servers or applications using Apache or Nginx is desirable. Familiarity with relational databases and tools for monitoring, alerting, and logging such as Splunk, Prometheus (Alertmanager, Loki, Thanos), and Grafana is also desired. General security awareness is a must.
   

  

 We value soft skills such as effective teamwork across different locations, a supportive attitude for developer teams, the ability to structure and prioritize tasks, problem-solving skills, dedication and a keen interest in learning, knowledge sharing and collaboration, and strong documentation abilities.
   

  

 Tasty bonus skills include experience working with heavy CI/CD pipelines in a multi-OS environment, implementing CI/CD using Kubernetes, and working with Agile methodologies.
   

  

**About King**
 At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Solution Architect, Asset
description:
Are you passionate about technology and eager to take on new challenges in a dynamic, forward-looking environment? We are looking for a Solution Architect to join our expert team in the Asset and Locations IT domain. In this role, you will be developing and maintaining cutting-edge solutions for Asset Management and Geographic Information Services that support our production fleets.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You will be working within a small team of technology experts In the Asset and locations IT domain. Our team is responsible for developing and maintaining companywide shared solutions related to Asset Management and Geographic Information Services for our production fleets.
   

  

 As a Solution Architect, your primary focus will be on our Maximo Asset Management solution, while also contributing to other key projects. You will design and implement changes in line with our Solution Architecture, ensuring the highest standards of performance and reliability.
   

  

**About You**
 As a person you are a curious, forward looking and motivated by change and new challenges. You have structured, solution-oriented and analytical mindset which drives your daily work. You are fluent in English and known for your open, transparent communication style that builds trust and fosters collaboration.
   

  

 To succeed in this role, you have:
   

  

  

* A bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Business Administration or related field.
* At least 5 years of firsthand working experience with multi-site, high availability Maximo environments as a Developer or Solution lead.
* The ability to Structure Architecture and facilitate Governance Processes.
* Proven communication and collaboration skills with business and IT stakeholders, and different expert teams.
* A deep understanding of IBM Maximo Asset Management technology, capabilities, and processes.


 Considered as your benefit:
   

  

  

* IBM Certified Deployment Professional, Maximo version 7 or higher.
* Experience with various programming languages and methodologies used in Maximo
* Experience working with diverse Integrations.
* Experience of cloud-based implementations.
* Knowledge of architecture description methodologies and techniques
* Working experience/knowledge of other Asset Management solutions.


**We Offer You**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your application by
 **25.8.2024** 
 at the latest. We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period. If you would like to hear more about the position, please contact Kim Danska, +358 50454 2387 or through e-mail kim.danska@fortum.com.
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com
   

  

 For contact with Swedish union representatives, please call +46 8 671 70 00.
   

  

 Fortums Akademiker: Malin Nordenhall
   

  

 Unionen: Birgitta Henriksson
   

  

 Ledarna: Lars-Ola Andersson

title: Senior Scrum Master
description:
*Har du erfarenhet av IT-utveckling och agilt arbetssätt? Vi inom Länsförsäkringar Fondliv AB letar just nu efter en senior Scrum Master som vill vara med och bidra till vår utveckling mot Ett Ledande Fondliv. Låter det intressant? Läs vidare!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som Senior Scrum Master arbetar du i våra lean-agila team inom affärsenheten Fondliv. Du fokuserar på att möjliggöra ett optimerat värdeflöde och förbättra de självorganiserade teamens förutsättningar och leveransförmåga. Detta uppnås genom att coacha, inspirera och utbilda teamen och deras intressenter i tillämpningen av lean-agila principer och metoder. Du kommer att röra dig mellan både team och tåg.
   

  

 Team perspektiv :
   

  

* Stödja i att lösa konflikter, problem och beslutsfattande.
* Stödja teammedlemmarnas personliga utveckling och kontinuerliga lärande.
* Hjälpa till att identifiera anti-patterns.
* Förbättra och stödja arbetsflödet genom att eliminera flaskhalsar, förseningar och slöseri.
* Coacha i "Built-in Quality Practices".
* Stödja teamet i att förstå sin kapacitet genom användning av story points samt stödja PO i att upprätthålla beslutade arbetssätt och processer.


 Tåg perspektiv :
   

  

* Hjälpa till att förbättra tågets övergripande välmående
* Bidra aktivt till att utveckla Scrum Master som kollektiv
* Facilitera samarbete mellan team vid behov.


**Vem är du?**
 För att passa in i rollen har du erfarenhet av arbete inom IT-utveckling, gärna bakgrund som utvecklare. Du är senior och har 5+ års erfarenhet av att implementera och arbeta lean agilt. Vi tror också vidare att du har god erfarenhet av områden som scrum, kanban och SAFe. Vidare har du relevant akademisk utbildning eller erfarenhet som vi bedömer som likvärdig. Goda kunskaper både skriftligt och muntligt i engelska och svenska är en förutsättning.
   

  

 Som person besitter du coachande ledaregenskaper som får andra att arbeta tillsammans på bästa sätt. Du är kommunikativ med förmåga att skapa väl fungerande samarbeten med andra delar av organisationen. Du har ett mod att hantera konflikter och trivs i en föränderlig miljö med stort utvecklingsfokus, högt tempo och flexibilitet.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Du välkomnas till avdelningen Transformation och IT inom affärsenhet Fondliv. Vi är idag ca 80 medarbetare med en utpräglad vilja att utveckla och driva förändring så väl digitalt som i det fysiska kundmötet. Att agera transparent, prestigelöst och känna stolthet för vårt område är viktigt hos oss. Vi ställer upp för varandra och hjälper andra att lyckas. Den rekryterande chefen har hög förväntan på självledarskap hos medarbetarna, är coachande och ser det som sin huvudsakliga uppgift att skapa förutsättningar för varje medarbetare att tillsammans med sitt team lyckas med sina uppdrag, ansvarsområden och leverans.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-08-31**
 Rekryteringsprocessen kommer ta en kort paus under semestern och vi kommer att återkoppla till alla sökanden i augusti. Tack för er förståelse och ha en riktigt bra sommar

title: Customer Experience Specialist to Samsung
description:
**Are you passionate about creating exceptional online experiences? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where you can make a significant impact on customer satisfaction? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!**
**About the role:**
 As the Customer Experience Specialist for our B2B sites and partner platform, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the online journey for our customers and partners. Your mission will be to ensure that our digital interfaces are not only user-friendly and accessible but also a pleasure to navigate. You'll be the driving force behind crafting a seamless and positive experience for every visitor.
   

  

 Our team today consists of the Customer Experience Manager, one Shop App, one UX-designer, one CRO Specialist, one Hybris Platform Deputy, and this role - our new customer experiences specialist.
   

  

 This is a new role, meaning it will require the person's responsibility to be self-driven and take their own initiative.
   

  

****Responsibilities include:****
* Own our enhanced partnership program site and the B2B site, to optimize the customer journey
* Execute initiatives and enchantments
* Act as a stakeholder to the operative team and other relevant teams within Samsung
* Make sure that you are involved in all initiatives involved with .com to align on EPP and B2B
* Be the person of contact for experience on the sites EPP and B2B
* Work in Adobe Experience Manager to be able and fix and request changes for the site
* Look into customization for the mapping of the sites


**About you:**
 Skills we are looking for:
   

  

* We think you have around 1 to 3 years of experience, working with similar tasks.
* Previous experience working with one or several content management systems (CMS)
* Experience working with a data-driven approach
* Knowledge on how to set requirements to optimize the user journey
* Experience working with backlog management
* Project management skills and follow-up up on projects
* Experience of one or more CMS


**Soft Skills**
* Enjoy quick changes in your way of working, big and small. You are a problem solver with an eye for the details
* Like networking within the company
* Self-motivated, takes a lot of initiative
* Comfortable and enjoys working with both technical and design development
* Stakeholder management and used to navigate between requests, dependencies, value and time


**About The Assignment**
 For this assignment you will be hired as a full-time consultant by Digitalenta. We offer our consultants a generous package including healthcare allowance, insurance policy, paid vacation days and pension savings. In addition, you'll also have a dedicated consultant manager available throughout your employment with us, in addition to optional networking activities with our network of consultants.
   

  

 The assignment is full-time and ongoing, starting as soon as possible.

title: Lead UX Content Designer
description:
**It’s All About People**
 We put people at the centre of everything we do. Being curious about what the people around us need and want is key to creating safe, personalised and sustainable mobility solutions. If you believe in the power of people and share our respect for human-centric innovation, you'll thrive at Volvo Cars. We are people who care about other people. With us, you’ll be surrounded by brilliant, curious colleagues all committed to making a difference.
   

  

**User Experience**
 Volvo Cars is on an ambitious journey to redefine what it means to give people freedom to move in the most innovative times in the mobility industry. Volvo Cars is looking to redefine all aspects of its eco-system - from the vehicle itself, to how it is owned, driven, powered and purchased online. User Experience as a discipline is a key part of Volvo Cars strategy and a newly formed UX organisation is helping gather insights about our user's and redefine and elevate the users experience of Volvo's products and services.
   

  

 The UX content design team at Volvo Cars is looking for a lead content designer for in-car user experiences.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Help design in-car software user experiences by writing clear, user-centered copy. Your first focus will be to create and implement a content strategy for in-car experiences.
* Create ways to scale user-centered writing across an organization of designers who work on car experiences.
* Prioritize and move between strategic and tactical content design work, pursuing opportunities for high impact while ensuring quality in all car software content.
* Create governance for content that is translated for consumers all over the world.
* Collaborate with content designers who work on connected experiences to define and implement writing style and terminology across journeys.
* Mentor other content designers.
* Shape and develop how we create and ship excellent user experiences alongside hardware development.
* Help shape and develop the content design practice by contributing to team foundations, like style guides, glossaries, controlled vocabularies, ways of working, etc.
* Contribute to and create new ways to achieve company-wide content governance, creating quality and cohesion across the many touch points of each customer’s relationship with Volvo Cars.


**Experience You’ll Bring**
* Using UX best practices to write for digital products and services. Maybe you’ve had other titles in the past, like UX writer, product writer, content strategist—the point is you understand design thinking, the importance of research, and typical practices of software development.
* Developing awareness and support for content design ways of working in a software product development environment. You enjoy pair writing, facilitating workshops and socializing your work.
* Informing your writing with user insights, from running your own user testing to participating in and supporting research initiatives. You believe research are our partners and the key to the success of any user experience.
* Becoming an expert in your problem space by seeking deep knowledge on the users, business needs, technical constraints and product goals in that space.
* Creating user-centered experiences that answer business needs.
* Experience working on global products. You know the dance of writing translation-friendly copy.
* You don’t have to be a native English speaker. You do need to have a mastery of grammar, voice, tonality, etc. Typical writer stuff!
* You have experience writing in English. We write in both British English and American English, so prepare to work with both.
* You enjoy collaboration and believe the successes of your colleagues are your successes. We’re a big company and we make incredible things happen together. Empathizing with and supporting your peers is the key to getting things done here.


 Application
   

  

 Applicants must provide a portfolio of work as part of their application. Please apply no later than 11th of August.
   

  

 Location
   

  

 Stockholm Tech Hub or Gothenburg HQ.
   

  

 Volvo Cars - Driving change together
   

  

 Volvo Cars’ success is the outcome of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, allowing you to reach your fullest potential.
   

  

 By 2025, we aim to sell 1.2 million cars annually, with 50 per cent being electric cars and sold directly to customers mainly through digital channels. Make sure you’re in the front seat on this exciting journey as we pioneer the driving and electrification technologies of the future.

title: Game Designer - Games
description:
We are looking for a talented Game Designer to join one of the game teams here at Embark, a team that is currently numbering around ~100 developers.
   

  

 As a Game Designer at Embark, you will be responsible for detailed design work on a project, writing, iterating and implementing designs for features and mechanics, delivering high quality, balanced and scalable systems and player experiences for a PvP Action Game, with large Live Service ambitions.
   

  

 You will collaborate closely with the Design Director and other designers of the project, in refining concepts and ideas into tangible designs, prototypes and features, as well as Production leadership helping in articulating and establishing estimates, project scope and timelines.
   

  

 You will also own and spearhead game features directly, and work hands-on in cross disciplinary teams while implementing Gameplay Features, together with Animators, Coders and other design disciplines.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Design, establish and hone emergent gameplay systems, including destruction and physics, as well as elemental gameplay
* Design, implementation, tweaking and balancing of weapons and character abilities
* PvP Game Mode design and implementation
* Game camera, character movement and controls design
* Design scoring, reward and social systems that support the core gameplay experience
* 3+ years of experience designing and making games and a proven track record with shipped games
* A good grasp of AAA PvP gameplay and systems design, including player psychology, UX design and gameplay mechanics and dynamics
* Some experience of using analytics, data and statistics to monitor game balance and behavior
* Proficiency with the Unreal Engine and experience with Blueprints and scripting.
* A creative and curious mind
* A good knowledge and familiarity with the various game maker disciplines, coding, animation, game physics, 3D Art, etc.
* A great creative collaborator in cross disciplinary groups
* Professional English communication skills


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!
   

  

*If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our "* 
*Open Application.* 
*"*

We are looking for a strong JavaScript frontend engineer with focus on React for a consultancy assignment.

Backend knowledge (Java, Scala)

  

Location: 3 days onsite work in the office in Malmö

title: Head of Digitalization & Business IT till Tyréns
description:
Är du en riktigt vass förändringsledare som brinner för att driva digital transformation och affärsutveckling? Är du dessutom en inspirerande ledare med gedigen erfarenhet och stark förmåga att leda team vars mål är att skapa bättre förutsättningar för dagens och framtidens städer?
   

  

 Då kan rollen som Head of Digitalization & Business IT på Tyréns vara rätt för dig!
   

  

 Tyréns är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom samhällsbyggnad. Med 2000 specialister inom stadsutveckling, arkitektur och infrastruktur bygger vi samhällen som håller.
   

  

 På Tyréns arbetar vi sömlöst med innovation, design och ingenjörskonst för att göra skillnad.
   

  

**Din vardag:**
 I rollen som Head of Digitalization & Business IT på Tyréns kommer du att leda en verksamhet som just nu befinner sig i en spännande förändringsresa för att ännu bättre kunna stötta och driva Tyréns digitala transformation. Som dina närmaste kollegor har du en IT-ledningsgrupp bestående av fem drivna och engagerade chefer.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta i nära samverkan med kärnverksamheten för att positionera Tyréns som ett konsultbolag i framkant och som en ledande aktör inom digital innovation.
   

  

 Ditt team spelar en avgörande roll för att stödja verksamheten med kritisk teknisk expertis. Som en strategisk affärspartner och ledare kommer du och ditt team fokusera på att utveckla IT-arbetsplatsen, hantera drift, förvaltningen och infrastruktur samt säkerställa IT-säkerheten i enlighet med verksamhetens behov. Du kommer även ha en central roll i att driva utvecklingen av Tyréns digitala tjänster.
   

  

 I din roll som Head of Digitalization & Business IT kommer du att ha en central roll i att främja full integration av IT som en affärspartner, med särskild tonvikt på att generera resultat och skapa mervärde för Tyréns kärnverksamhet.
   

  

 Du kommer även att:
   

  

* Utveckla IT som organisation och dess tillhörande processer för ökad effektivitet.
* Coacha dina chefer och medarbetare för att nå deras fulla potential.
* Utmana och inspirera ditt team genom att vara en lyhörd och tydlig ledare.


 Som Head of Digitalization & Business IT rapporterar du till Head of Business Support & Business Development. Du ingår I ledningsgruppen för Business Support and Business Development tillsammans med bland annat Tyréns chefsjurist samt ansvariga chefer för hållbarhet, HR och kommunikation. Tjänsten är placerad på Tyréns huvudkontor på Södermalm, Stockholm.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som är en strategisk ledare med gedigen erfarenhet av att driva digital transformation och affärsutveckling. Du har ett starkt affärssinne och förstår hur teknologi används för att skapa affärsvärde. Din ledarstil präglas av att vara en inspirerande ledare som är både inkluderande och lyhörd. Samtidigt har du förmågan att fatta snabba och strategiska beslut och du kan driva den digitala utvecklingen med fokus på effektivitet och gott samarbete i ditt team.
   

  

 Tyréns är en värderingsdriven organisation och vi ser att du kan leda ditt team i enlighet med våra ledord som är
 *Connect* 
 ,
 *Challenge & Create.*
 För att lyckas i tjänsten ser vi också att du har:
   

  

* Relevant högskoleutbildning inom data/IT eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Erfarenhet av att leda och driva en modern IT-organisation med fokus på digitalisering och nära samverkan med verksamheten.
* Erfarenhet av att leda virtuella, diversifierade och agila team, inklusive andra chefer.
* Erfarenhet av att skapa effektivt samarbete mellan IT och andra affärsfunktioner.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
* Det är meriterande med erfarenhet av paketering av digitala tjänster.


**Om Tyréns**
 Tyréns är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom samhällsbyggnad. I samspel med kunder och partners skapar vi hållbara lösningar inom stadsutveckling och infrastruktur. Vi har totalt 3 000 medarbetare och verksamhet i Sverige, England, Estland, Litauen, Polen och Bulgarien. Tyréns är stiftelseägt och vår ägandeform gör det möjligt för oss att satsa målmedvetet på forskning och utveckling inom samhällsbyggnadsområdet. Vi drivs av nyfikenhet och har ett nära samarbete med universitet och högskolor.
   

  

**Ansökan & kontakt**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Tyréns med Wise IT. Vill du veta mer om jobbet, kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult; Sandra Åhs på telefon 076- 167 0328 eller sandra.ahs@wiseit.se . Wise IT kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via e-post, då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 För denna roll kommer det att utföras en bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidaten.
   

  

 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan.
